Items.Title: InputValidation
Items.Subtitle: A feature to display developer-defined errors for text values
Items.Description: A feature that will display an error for invalid text. The app is notified when text has been changed by the user and is responsible for determining whether the text is valid and the error message
Items.Content: Look at the InputValidationPage.xaml file in Visual Studio to see the full code for this page.

Items.Title: Button
Items.Subtitle: A control that responds to user input and raises a Click event.
Items.Description: The Button control provides a Click event to respond to user input from a touch, mouse, keyboard, stylus, or other input device. You can put different kinds of content in a button, such as text or an image, or you can restyle a button to give it a new look.
Items.Content:
The main purpose of a Button is to make something happen when a user clicks it. There are two ways you can make something happen:

  • Handle the Click event.
  • Bind the Command property to an ICommand implementation that describes the command logic.

Buttons often have only simple string content, but you can use any object as content. You can also change the style and template to give them any look you want.

Look at the ButtonPage.xaml file in Visual Studio to see the custom button style and template definitions used on this page.

Items.Title: ColorPaletteResources
Items.Subtitle: A type of resource that allows you to apply custom colors to your controls.
Items.Description: Apply custom colors to your controls through this cascading API, or scope them to a local subset.

Items.Title: Compact Sizing
Items.Subtitle: How to use a Resource Dictionary to enable compact sizing.
Items.Description: Compact dictionary included in WinUI 2.1. Allows you to create compact smaller apps by adding this at the page or the grid level.

Items.Title: System Backdrops (Mica/Acrylic)
Items.Subtitle: System backdrops, like Mica and Acrylic, for the window.
Items.Description: System backdrops are used to provide a different background for a Window other than the default white or black (depending on Light or Dark theme). Mica and Desktop Acrylic are the current supported backdrops. There are two options for applying a backdrop: first, to use built-in Mica/Acrylic types, which have no customization and are simple to apply. The second is to create a customizable backdrop, which requires more code.
Items.Content: Look at the SampleSystemBackdropsWindow.xaml.cs file in Visual Studio to see the full code for applying a backdrop.

Items.Title: FilePicker
Items.Subtitle: Access files and folders through the file pickers.
Items.Description: Shows how to access files and folders by letting the user choose them through the file pickers and how to save a file so that the user can specify the name, file type, and location of a file to save.
Items.Content: Look at the FilePickerPage.xaml file in Visual Studio to see the full code for this page.
